intro: Cardamine microzyga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved watercress, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to moist environments in North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants. The plant has delicate, trifoliate leaves that are often submerged or floating in shallow water. Its small white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces cylindrical, segmented pods that contain several seeds. Cardamine microzyga is often found in stream banks, wet meadows, and other aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
